subject: AI
title: Function Calling
description: Let the model invoke structured functions instead of just generating text.

hook.text: You ask an LLM for today's weather. It can't check the weather â€” it's just text. But with function calling, it can request that YOUR code checks, then use the result.

buildup.text: Function calling lets you describe available functions (name, parameters, types) to the model. Instead of answering directly, it can return a structured function call for your code to execute.

discovery.text: The flow: user asks a question â†’ model decides a function would help â†’ returns a JSON function call â†’ your code runs the function â†’ you send the result back â†’ model gives the final answer.

twist.text: The model doesn't execute anything. It only generates the function call as structured output. Your application is responsible for actually running it â€” and for validating the arguments first.

climax.text: Function calling turns LLMs from text generators into orchestrators. They can query databases, call APIs, perform calculations â€” anything you expose as a function.

punchline.text: Function calling gives the LLM hands. It decides what to do; your code does the doing.

quiz.question: Who actually executes the function in LLM function calling?
options: The cloud provider runs it automatically
Your application code executes it after receiving the model's request
The function runs itself when called
